text: if I had to tell the young women here
three things I would say Pro probably
not a whole lot different from what I
would tell the young man which is one
spend time with your classmates they're
amazing I think for women I would say do
spend a little bit of extra time with
the women in your class because they
will be important to you in many ways
during the rest of your life they just
will there's something special about
sharing certain experiences that you're
having as a woman in business business
that were certainly not as different for
my generation as for the women even just
5 years in front of me but it's still
different being a woman in business
whether you're in the for-profit or non
for-profit
sector I'd say experiment take a lot of
things that are new and interesting that
you might not be interested but you
never know how that kind of knowledge or
the person you might meet in that class
may have an effect on you five or 10
years out I took a lot of classes that I
thought would be just interesting to me
and helpful in my career and I should
have taken probably a few more that were
out of my comfort zone and out of my
likely universe but that just I should
have just taken them for fun and i' had
done that in college and there are more
opportunities now to do that here at the
business school and I would
say the third thing is when you're
thinking about your job after school
relax do something you love if you don't
like it after two years you can change
just do a great job when you're there
learn something and figure out an
elegant exit strategy for yourself if
you're happy if you're really miserable
just call it quits but there are no
wrong mistakes that you can make when
you leave Harvard Business School you're
bright you have a great network of
people you're well educated you've spent
time and invested in your own human
capital go out and enjoy whatever you do
there probably still a lot of shs here
you got to not pay attention to those
because I would say that now when I'm
doing something not just that I like but
I love that it's much easier to get up
in the morning and you just you just
feel Joy in the rest of your life all of
us who go to HBS are going to spend a
lot of our time working whatever that
means to you and doing something that
you're really passionate about and that
you care about is going to make all the
difference in how well you do how that
projects to the world and how you feel
about yourself every day so I think
that's that's
important
